result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darious Armon Young

records.addlTxt: Order Allowing the Defendant to Appear via ZOOM /s/ PB 10/24/22

1:45 PM Defendant Darious Armon Young appeared by phone.  Attorney Nathan T Oswald in court for Darious Armon Young.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Oswald had filed a motion/order for this client to appear via ZOOM late on Friday afternoon.
Court reviews the motion/order.
Court questions ADA Pfeil if he objects; he does not.
Court verifies the address and phone # of the defendant.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Atty Oswald would ask that his client be excused from appearing for the Pre-Trial Conference.
State is in compliance with victim rights legislation and no victims appear today.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 
Court informs the parties that if the Preliminary Hearing is contested that the parties will need to set this with the assigned Judge on a date other than the Preliminary Hearing dates.
Defendant can appear via ZOOM or telephone.

Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Order on Defendant's Motion to Appear by ZOOM at Initial Appearance filed by Atty Nathan Oswald (sent to Br 3 Judge on 10/24/22 sp) (filed on 10/21/22 @ 4:12 p.m.)
Defendant's Motion to Appear by ZOOM at Initial Appearance filed by Atty Nathan Oswald (sent to Br 3 Judge on 10/24/22 sp) (filed on 10/21/22 @ 4:12 p.m.)
Defendant's Request for Discovery filed by Atty Nathan T Oswald
Initial Appearance set for 10/24/22 @ 1:30 p.m. in Br 3
Initial Appearance set for 10/03/22 @ 2:30 p.m. in Br 3
Stay off the premises of Walmart stores.

01:00 PM Defendant Jaqualan Bond, and co-defendants Reginal Bond, Kiron Green, and Darious Young appeared by video.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutchler in court for State of WI. Attorney Taylor Soule  appears on behalf of the defendants.

ADA Mutchler states facts for anticipated charges of Theft or Party to a Crime. 
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendants Reginal Bond, Jaqualan Bond, Kiron Green, and Darious Young are eligible for public defender representation at this time.

Reginald Bond: State requests a cash $500.00 bond with conditions as stated. 
Jaqualan Bond: State requests a cash $500.00 bond with conditions as stated.
Darious Young: State requests a cash $500.00 bond with conditions as stated.
Kiron Green: State requests a cash $500.00 bond with conditions as stated.
Attorney for the defendants objects to cash bond and states reasons on the record. 
Court sets signature bonds for the defendants.
Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
